<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// Inserts the address range. If the range overlaps with an existing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// range, the range that it overlaps with will be returned and the two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// address ranges will be unioned together in &quot;Ranges&quot;. If a duplicate</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// entry is attempted to be added, the duplicate range will not actually be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// added and the returned iterator will point to end().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">    ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// This is used for finding overlapping ranges in the DW&#95;AT&#95;ranges</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// attribute of a DIE. It is also used as a set of address ranges that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// children address ranges must all be contained in.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// iterator to the overlapping range info. If a duplicate entry is</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Verifies the header of a unit in a .debug&#95;info or .debug&#95;types section.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function currently checks for:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Unit is in 32-bit DWARF format. The function can be modified to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// support 64-bit format.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The DWARF version is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The unit type is valid (if unit is in version &gt;=5)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The unit doesn&#39;t extend beyond the containing section</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The address size is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param DebugInfoData The section data</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param Offset A reference to the offset start of the unit. The offset will</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - addresses within a sequence that decrease in value</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> verifyDebugLineRows();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Verify that an Apple-style accelerator table is valid.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function currently checks that:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The fixed part of the header fits in the section</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The size of the section is as large as what the header describes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - There is at least one atom</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The form for each atom is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The tag for each DIE in the table is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The buckets have a valid index, or they are empty</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Each hashdata offset is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Each DIE is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AccelSection pointer to the section containing the acceleration table</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param StrData pointer to the string section</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param SectionName the name of the table we&#39;re verifying</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\returns The number of errors occurred during verification</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Verify that the DWARF v5 accelerator table is valid.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This function currently checks that:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Headers individual Name Indices fit into the section and can be parsed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Abbreviation tables can be parsed and contain valid index attributes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   with correct form encodings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The CU lists reference existing compile units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - The buckets have a valid index, or they are empty.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - All names are reachable via the hash table (they have the correct hash,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   and the hash is in the correct bucket).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - Information in the index entries is complete (all required entries are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   present) and consistent with the debug&#95;info section DIEs.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param AccelSection section containing the acceleration table</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\param StrData string section</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
